Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania needed that route to remain in League C once again last time out, meaning that they have competed in League C across all four editions of the Nations League so far.
A two-legged victory over Gibraltar back in March saw Lithuania keep their place at this level, following on from one of their best qualifying campaigns in recent years.
Edgaras Jankauskas's side finished fourth ahead of Bulgaria in their Euro 2024 qualifying section, beating the Lions, and holding Hungary and Montenegro to draws along the way.
Cyprus lost all eight matches with a goal difference of minus-25, and they also lost to Moldova in early June, with a 4-1 win over San Marino shortly after doing little to ease the pressure.
Taking five points from six games in their last Nations League campaign was enough to avoid the relegation playoff even though they finished bottom of their section.
